info.title: Device Messaging API
info.description: Use these APIs from a device to send device-to-cloud messages to an IoT hub, receive cloud-to-device messages from an IoT hub, and to upload files from a device. All task operations conform to the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification. Each API call must include the api-version query parameter. In addition, either an X.509 client certificate or an authorization header containing a Shared Access Signature token with the appropriate permissions must be presented.

get.description: This method is used to retrieve a cloud-to-device message.
get.summary: This method is used to retrieve a cloud-to-device message. See https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-messaging for more information.

200.description: The body can be any octet-stream. Note that the size of the whole message (body plus properties) must be less than 256 Kb.

204.description: NoContent. Sent if device message queue is empty.

FileUploadRequest.description: Contains a request from a device to upload a file.

FileUploadResponse.description: Contains the response to a device request to upload a file.

correlationId.description: Unique id for this file upload request/response.

sasToken.description: SAS Token to read+write to blob.

FileUploadCompletionStatus.description: Contains the file upload completion status including correlationId and status fields.

correlationId.description: This follows the format: <expiryTime>_<guid>_<filename> where <expiryTime> is UTC time in 'yyyyMMddHHmm' format.
